Key Arguments: The bill threatens freedom of speech, which is fundamental to democracy.
Existing laws are sufficient to handle issues like hate speech and false alarms.
The bill could lead to government or powerful entities deciding what is true or false, which is dangerous.
Censorship is not the solution to bad speech; more speech and debate are.
Historical examples show that regimes using censorship were oppressive.
The bill could lead to self-censorship and fear of government.
Truth is not static; what is considered true today may be proven false tomorrow.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is fundamental for every one of us.
The solution to 'Bad Speech' is never censorship. It is 'Good Speech' and plenty of it.
Today's Truth is tomorrow's embarrassing mistake.
The bill is misguided. Please oppose it.
